001package intermediate;
002
003import com.sandwich.koan.Koan;
004
005import java.time.Instant;
006import java.time.LocalDate;
007import java.time.LocalDateTime;
008import java.time.ZoneId;
009import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
010import java.time.format.FormatStyle;
011
012import static com.sandwich.koan.constant.KoanConstants.__;
013import static com.sandwich.util.Assert.assertEquals;
014
015
016public class AboutDates {
017
018    private LocalDateTime date = LocalDateTime.ofInstant(Instant.ofEpochMilli(100010001000L), ZoneId.of("-07:00"));
019
020    @Koan
021    public void dateToString() {
022        assertEquals(date.toString(), __);
023    }
024
025    @Koan
026    public void changingDateValue() {
027        date = date.plusHours(1);
028        assertEquals(date.toString(), __);
029    }
030
031    @Koan
032    public void usingPlusToChangeDatesDoesntWrapOtherFields() {
033        date = date.plusMonths(12);
034        assertEquals(date.toString(), __);
035    }
036
037    @Koan
038    public void usingDateTimeFormatterToFormatDate() {
039        String formattedDate = DateTimeFormatter.ISO_DATE.format(date);
040        assertEquals(formattedDate, __);
041    }
042
043    @Koan
044    public void usingDateTimeFormatterToFormatDateShort() {
045        // Careful, formatted dates may contain non-breaking spaces!
046        String formattedDate = DateTimeFormatter.ofLocalizedDateTime(FormatStyle.SHORT).format(date);
047        assertEquals(formattedDate, __);
048    }
049
050    @Koan
051    public void usingDateTimeFormatterToFormatDateFull() {
052        String formattedDate = DateTimeFormatter.ofLocalizedDateTime(FormatStyle.MEDIUM).format(date);
053        // There is also FormatStyle.LONG and FormatStyle.FULL... you get the idea ;-)
054        assertEquals(formattedDate, __);
055    }
056
057    @Koan
058    public void usingDateTimeFormatterToParseDates() {
059        DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MM-dd-yyyy");
060        LocalDate date2 = LocalDate.parse("01-01-2000", formatter);
061        assertEquals(date2.toString(), __);
062        // What happened to the time? What do you need to change to keep the time as well?
063    }
064}
